analyzed: tad jā vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ tad jam vijñānam idam nāmasya
translated: The feeling, perception, volitions and consciousness that arise from that are the name part.

original: ity etad ayoniśomanasikārasahitaṃ nāmarūpaṃ pratītya mātuḥ kukṣau sparśasyābhinirvṛttir bhavati prādurbhāvaḥ /
analyzed: iti etat a yoni śomanasikāra sahitam nāma rūpam pratītya mātuḥ kukṣau sparśasya abhinirvṛttiḥ bhavati prādurbhāvaḥ
translated: Thus, dependent on name-and-form accompanied by improper attention, the manifestation and appearance of contact occurs in the mother's womb.

original: tad ucyate nāmarūpapratyayaḥ DhskD sparśaḥ /
analyzed: tat ucyate nāma rūpa pratyayaḥ sparśaḥ
translated: That is said to be contact with name-and-form as condition.

original: api khalv evam uktaṃ bhagavatā svātiṃ bhikṣuṃ kaivartapūrviṇam ārabhya /
analyzed: api khalu evam uktam bhagavatā svātim bhikṣum kaivarta pūrviṇam ārabhya
translated: Moreover, the Blessed One has said this in relation to the monk Svāti, who was formerly a fisherman:

analyzed: trayāṇām bhikṣavaḥ sannipātāt mātuḥ kukṣau garbhasya avakrāntiḥ bhavati
translated: Monks, the entry of the embryo into the mother's womb occurs through the coming together of three factors.

original: vistareṇa yāvad /
analyzed: vistareṇa yāvat
translated: In detail, up to...

original: ayoniśomanasikārasahajaṃ DhskD
analyzed: a yoni śomanasikāra sahajam
translated: Name-and-form accompanied by improper attention

original: nāmarūpaṃ pratītya mātuḥ kukṣau garbhasyāvakrāntir bhavati prādurbhāvas /
analyzed: nāma rūpam pratītya mātuḥ kukṣau garbhasya avakrāntiḥ bhavati prādurbhāvaḥ
translated: dependent on name-and-form, the entry of the embryo into the mother's womb occurs, its appearance.

original: tad ucyate nāmarūpapratyayaḥ sparśaḥ /
analyzed: tat ucyate nāma rūpa pratyayaḥ sparśaḥ
translated: That is said to be contact with name-and-form as condition.

original: yathā khalv ihaikatyo rāgaparyavasthito dveṣaparyavasthito mohaparyavasthitaḥ DhskD
analyzed: yathā khalu iha ekatyaḥ rāga paryavasthitaḥ dveṣa paryavasthitaḥ moha paryavasthitaḥ
translated: For example, here someone, overcome by passion, overcome by hatred, overcome by delusion,

analyzed: kāyena duścaritam carati

analyzed: tat ucyate nāma rūpa pratyayaḥ sparśaḥ iti
translated: That is called 'contact with name-and-form as its condition.'

original: yathā narakeṣv evaṃ tiryakpreteṣu /
analyzed: yathā narakeṣu evam tiryak preteṣu
translated: Just as in the hells, so also among animals and ghosts.

analyzed: yathā khalu iha ekatyaḥ manuṣya sukhakeṣu avekṣāvān bhavati pratibaddha cittaḥ
translated: Just as here someone is intent on human pleasures, his mind attached,

analyzed: vistareṇa dhskd yāvat
translated: in detail up to...

original: kāyena vācā sucaritaṃ caratīti idaṃ rūpasya /🔽manasā sucaritaṃ caratīti idaṃ rūpasya /🔽manasā sucaritaṃ caratīti idaṃ nāmasyety /
analyzed: kāyena vācā su caritam carati iti idam rūpasya  manasā su caritam carati iti idam rūpasya  manasā su caritam carati iti idam nāmasya iti
translated: The statement one engages in good conduct with body and speech refers to form.🔽The statement one engages in good conduct with the mind refers to name.🔽The statement one engages in good conduct with the mind refers to name.

analyzed: etat kuśalam nāma rūpam pratītya vistareṇa dhskd  yāvat
translated: Dependent on this wholesome name-and-form, in detail up to...

original: tatra ca sparśam abhinirvartayati /
analyzed: tatra ca sparśam abhinirvartayati

translated: That is called contact with name-and-form as condition.

analyzed: yathā brahmakāyikānām evam yāvat asaṃjñi satva saṃgṛhītānām bṛhat phalānām
translated: Just as with the Brahmakāyika gods, so up to those included in the Asaṃjñisattvas and the Bṛhatphalas.

translated: Moreover, this has been said by the Blessed One in this extensive explanation of the Mahānidāna Sūtra to the venerable Ānanda.

original: asti pratyayam ānanda sparśa iti /
analyzed: asti pratyayam ānanda sparśa iti
translated: There is contact, Ānanda, with a condition.

original: vistareṇa yāvat /
analyzed: vistareṇa yāvat
translated: In detail up to.

original: yeṣām ānandākārāṇāṃ yeṣām uddeśānāṃ sati nāmakāyasya prajñaptir bhavati teṣām ākārāṇāṃ teṣām uddeśānām asaty api DhskD
analyzed: yeṣām ānanda ākārāṇām yeṣām uddeśānām sati nāmakāyasya prajñaptiḥ bhavati teṣām ākārāṇām teṣām uddeśānām asati api
translated: Ānanda, for those aspects and those topics, when the collection of names exists, there is designation. For those aspects and those topics, when the collection of names does not exist, Ānanda, there is no designation.

original: nu adhivacanasaṃsparśaḥ prajñāyeta /
analyzed: nu adhivacana saṃsparśaḥ prajñāyeta

original: no bhadanta /

original: DhskD no bhadanta /
analyzed: no bhadanta

original: no bhadanta /
analyzed: no bhadanta
translated: No, Venerable One.

original: sukhānugataṃ na sukhasaumanasyaparītam avakrāntaṃ caiva sukhena hetur api mahānāman🔽na prajñāyeta sattvānāṃ DhskD
analyzed: sukha anugatam na sukha saumanasya parītam avakrāntam ca eva sukhena hetuḥ api mahā nāman  na prajñāyeta sattvānām
translated: and not accompanied by happiness, and not entered into by one who is full of happiness and joy, then even the cause of happiness would not be known, O Mahānāman,

original: vijñāne saṃrāgāya na ceme satvā vijñāne saṃrajyeran /
analyzed: vijñāne saṃrāgāya na ca ime satvāḥ vijñāne saṃrajyeran
translated: for beings to become attached to consciousness, and if these beings would not become attached to consciousness,🔽but because, O Mahānāman, consciousness is not exclusively suffering, but is also happiness,

original: yasmāt tu mahānāman vijñānaṃ naikāntaduḥkhaṃ sukhaṃ sukhānugataṃ sukhasaumanasyaparītaṃ
analyzed: yasmāt tu mahānāman vijñānam na ekānta duḥkham sukham sukha anugatam sukha saumanasya parītam
translated: But, Mahānāman, because consciousness is not exclusively suffering, but is pleasant, accompanied by pleasure, pervaded by joy,

original: anavakrāntam eva sukhena tasmād ime satvā vijñāne saṃrajyante saṃraktāḥ saṃyujyante DhskD
analyzed: an avakrāntam eva sukhena tasmāt ime satvāḥ vijñāne saṃrajyante saṃraktāḥ saṃyujyante
translated: and has not yet entered into suffering, therefore these beings become attached to consciousness, being attached, they unite,

original: saṃyuktāḥ saṃkliṣyante /
analyzed: saṃyuktāḥ saṃkliṣyante
translated: being united, they are defiled.

original: ity etad vijñānāsvādavedayitaṃ pratītya vistareṇa yāvat tṛṣṇā /
analyzed: iti etat vijñāna āsvāda vedayitam pratītya vistareṇa yāvat tṛṣṇā
translated: Thus, this is the experience of the taste of consciousness, dependent on which, in detail, up to craving arises.

original: tad ucyate vedanāpratyayā tṛṣṇā /
analyzed: tat ucyate vedanā pratyayā tṛṣṇā
translated: That is said to be craving with feeling as a condition.

original: api khalv evam uktaṃ bhagavatā paurṇamāsike vyākaraṇe /
analyzed: api khalu evam uktam bhagavatā paurṇamāsike vyākaraṇe
translated: Moreover, it was said by the Blessed One in the Pūrṇamāsī Vyakaraṇa:

original: yad bhikṣavo rūpaṃ pratītyotpadyate DhskD 🔽sukham utpadyate saumanasyam ayaṃ rūpe āsvādaḥ /
analyzed: yat bhikṣavaḥ rūpam pratītya utpadyate  sukham utpadyate saumanasyam ayam rūpe āsvādaḥ
translated: Monks, whatever pleasure arises dependent on form,🔽whatever joy arises, this is the taste in form.

original: ity etad rūpāsvādavedayitaṃ pratītya yāvat tṛṣṇā /
analyzed: iti etat rūpa āsvāda vedayitam pratītya yāvat tṛṣṇā
translated: Thus, this is the experience of the taste of form, dependent on which, in detail, up to craving arises.

original: tad ucyate vedanāpratyayā tṛṣṇā /
analyzed: tat ucyate vedanā pratyayā tṛṣṇā
translated: That is said to be craving with feeling as a condition.

original: yad bhikṣavo vedanāsaṃjñāsaṃskārān yad vijñānaṃ pratītyotpadyate sukham utpadyate saumanasyam DhskD
analyzed: yat bhikṣavaḥ vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārān yat vijñānam pratītya utpadyate sukham utpadyate saumanasyam dhskd
translated: Monks, whatever pleasure arises dependent on feeling, dependent on perception, dependent on volitional formations, dependent on consciousness, whatever joy arises,

original: ayaṃ vijñāne āsvāda /
analyzed: ayam vijñāne āsvāda
translated: this is the taste in consciousness.

original: ity etad vijñānāsvādavedayitaṃ pratītya bhūyo bhūyo vijñāne apratikūlatā saṃtiṣṭhate /
analyzed: iti etat vijñāna āsvāda vedayitam pratītya bhūyas bhūyas vijñāne a pratikūla tā saṃtiṣṭhate
translated: Thus, this experience of the taste of consciousness, dependent on feeling, is the non-aversion to consciousness again and again.

original: apratikūle sati bhūyo bhūyo vijñāne utpadyate rāgaḥ saṃrāgaḥ ālayo niyantir adhyavasānam DhskD tṛṣṇā /
analyzed: a pratikūle sati bhūyas bhūyas vijñāne utpadyate rāgaḥ saṃrāgaḥ ālayaḥ niyantiḥ adhyavasānam dhskd tṛṣṇā
translated: When there is non-aversion, attachment, full attachment, affection, bondage, and clinging to consciousness again and again arises.

original: tad ucyate vedanāpratyayā tṛṣṇā /
analyzed: tat ucyate vedanā pratyayā tṛṣṇā
translated: That is said to be craving with feeling as its condition.

original: api khalv evam uktaṃ bhagavatā mahānidānaparyāye āyuṣmaty ānande /
analyzed: api khalu evam uktam bhagavatā mahānidānaparyāye āyuṣmati ānande
translated: Moreover, this was said by the Blessed One in the discourse on the great basis to the venerable Ānanda:

original: tatrānanda yā ca bhavatṛṣṇā yā ca vibhavatṛṣṇā itīme dve tṛṣṇādvayena vedanāsamavasaraṇe DhskD bhavataḥ /
analyzed: tatra ānanda yā ca bhava tṛṣṇā yā ca vibhava tṛṣṇā iti ime dve tṛṣṇā dvayena vedanā samavasaraṇe bhavataḥ
translated: There, Ānanda, the craving for existence and the craving for non-existence - these two types of craving are included in feeling, Ānanda.

original: tad ucyate vedanāpratyayā tṛṣṇā //
analyzed: tat ucyate vedanā pratyayā tṛṣṇā
translated: That is said to be craving with feeling as its condition.

original: tṛṣṇāpratyayam upādānam
analyzed: tṛṣṇā pratyayam upādānam
translated: With craving as condition, clinging

original: uddānaṃ //
analyzed: uddānam
translated: The summary:

original: tatprathamābhinipātaḥ kāmaiś cāvekṣāvāṃs tathā
analyzed: tad prathama abhinipātaḥ kāmaiḥ ca avekṣāvān tathā
translated: The first impact, and also looking with desire,

original: dṛṣṭir vicikitsā upādānaṃ vibhāgo nandam eva ca //
analyzed: dṛṣṭiḥ vicikitsā upādānam vibhāgaḥ nandam eva ca
translated: View, doubt, clinging, division, and joy itself.

original: tṛṣṇāpratyayam upādānaṃ katamad /
analyzed: tṛṣṇā pratyayam upādānam katamat
translated: What is clinging with craving as its condition?

original: āha /
analyzed: āha
translated: It is said:

original: yat prathamābhinipātaṃ DhskD
analyzed: yat prathama abhinipātam dhskd
translated: The first impact,

original: tṛṣṇāvaipulyam upādānaṃ yathā katham iti /
analyzed: tṛṣṇā vaipulyam upādānam yathā katham iti
translated: Clinging is the abundance of craving. How is it so?

original: yathā khalv ihaikatyaḥ kāmeṣv avekṣāvān bhavati pratibaddhacittaḥ kāmarāgaparyavasthānaṃ utpādayati /
analyzed: yathā khalu iha ekatyaḥ kāmeṣu avekṣāvān bhavati pratibaddha cittaḥ kāma rāga paryavasthānam utpādayati
translated: For example, here someone is full of longing for sensual pleasures, his mind is bound, he produces the envelopment of sensual desire.

original: sa tasmāt paryavasthānād anyaṃ paryavasthānam utpādayati DhskD
analyzed: sa tasmāt paryavasthānāt anyam paryavasthānam utpādayati
translated: He produces another envelopment from that envelopment,

original: adhimātrād adhimātrataraṃ tīvrāt tīvrataraṃ pūrṇāt pūritataraṃ /
analyzed: adhimātrāt adhimātrataram tīvrāt tīvrataram pūrṇāt pūritataram
translated: more intense than the intense, more powerful than the powerful, more complete than the complete.

original: iti pūrvakaṃ paryavasthānaṃ tṛṣṇā paścimam upādānaṃ tad ucyante tṛṣṇāpratyayaṃ upādānaṃ /🔽yathā khalv ihaikatyo rūpeṣv ārūpyeṣv avekṣāvān bhavati pratibaddhacitta DhskD
analyzed: iti pūrvakam paryavasthānam tṛṣṇā paścimam upādānam tat ucyante tṛṣṇā pratyayam upādānam  yathā khalu iha ekatyaḥ rūpeṣu ārūpyeṣu avekṣāvān bhavati
translated: Thus the previous envelopment is craving, the subsequent one is clinging. That is said to be clinging with craving as a condition.

original: ārūpyarāgaparyavasthānam utpādayati /
analyzed: ārūpya rāga paryavasthānam utpādayati
translated: For example, here someone is full of longing for the formless, his mind is bound, he produces the envelopment of formless desire.

original: sa tasmāt paryavasthānād anyat paryavasthānam utpādayati adhimātrād adhimātrataraṃ yāvat paripūrṇāt paripūrṇataraṃ /
analyzed: sa tasmāt paryavasthānāt anyat paryavasthānam utpādayati adhimātrāt adhimātrataram yāvat paripūrṇāt paripūrṇataram
translated: He produces another envelopment from that envelopment, more intense than the intense, up to more complete than the complete.

original: iti pūrvakaṃ paryavasthānaṃ tṛṣṇā paścimam upādānam /
analyzed: iti pūrvakam paryavasthānam tṛṣṇā paścimam upādānam
translated: Thus the previous envelopment is craving, the subsequent one is clinging.

original: DhskD tad ucyate tṛṣṇāpratyayam upādānaṃ /
analyzed: tat ucyate tṛṣṇā pratyayam upādānam
translated: That is said to be clinging with craving as a condition.

original: asti khalv evam uktaṃ bhagavatā pātaleyavyākaraṇe /
analyzed: asti khalu evam uktam bhagavatā pātaleya vyākaraṇe
translated: Indeed, this has been said by the Blessed One in the Pātālī Vyākaraṇa:

original: deśitā vo bhikṣavo mayā dharmāḥ skandhānāṃ pravicayāya /
analyzed: deśitāḥ vaḥ bhikṣavaḥ mayā dharmāḥ skandhānām pravicayāya
translated: Monks, the dharmas taught by me for the discernment of the aggregates are:

original: yad uta catvāri smṛtyupasthānāni catvāri samyakpradhānāni DhskD
analyzed: yat uta catvāri smṛti upasthānāni catvāri samyak pradhānāni
translated: Namely, the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts,

original: catvāra ṛddhipādāḥ paṃcendriyāṇi paṃca balāni sapta bodhyaṃgāny āryāṣṭāṃgo mārga /
analyzed: catvāraḥ ṛddhipādāḥ paṃca indriyāṇi paṃca balāni sapta bodhyaṃgāni ārya aṣṭāṃgaḥ mārga
translated: the four bases of supernatural power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of awakening, and the noble eightfold path.

original: evaṃ deśiteṣu vo bhikṣavo mayā dharmeṣu skandhānāṃ pravicayāya /
analyzed: evam deśiteṣu vaḥ bhikṣavaḥ mayā dharmeṣu skandhānām pravicayāya
translated: Monks, when the dharmas are taught by me in this way for the discernment of the aggregates,

original: atha ca punar ihaikatyā mohapuruṣā na tīvracchandā viharanti na tīvrasnehā na tīvrapremāṇo DhskD
analyzed: atha ca punar iha ekatyāḥ moha puruṣāḥ na tīvra chandāḥ viharanti na tīvra snehāḥ na tīvra premāṇaḥ dhskd
translated: Yet, in this regard, some deluded people do not dwell with intense zeal, intense affection, intense love,

original: na tīvrapramādās /
analyzed: na tīvra pramādāḥ
translated: Nor with intense heedlessness.

original: te dhandham evānuttaryaṃ spṛśanti yad utāsravāṇāṃ kṣayāya /
analyzed: te dhandham eva anuttaryam spṛśanti yat uta āsravāṇām kṣayāya
translated: They only touch the unsurpassed after a long time, namely the destruction of the defilements.

original: evaṃ deśiteṣu vo bhikṣavo mayā dharmeṣu skandhānāṃ pravicayāya /
analyzed: evam deśiteṣu vaḥ bhikṣavaḥ mayā dharmeṣu skandhānām pravicayāya
translated: Monks, when the dharmas are taught by me in this way for the discernment of the aggregates,

original: atha ca punar ihaikatyāḥ kulaputrāḥ atīvatīvracchandā viharanti atīvatīvrasnehā DhskD
analyzed: atha ca punar iha ekatyāḥ kula putrāḥ atīva tīvra chandāḥ viharanti atīva tīvra snehāḥ
translated: Yet, in this regard, some sons of good family dwell with extremely intense zeal, with extremely intense affection,

original: atīvatīvrapremāṇo 'tīvatīvrapramādās /
analyzed: atīva tīvra premāṇaḥ tīva tīvra pramādāḥ
translated: With extremely intense love, with extremely intense heedlessness.

original: te kṣipram evānuttaryaṃ spṛśanti yad utāsravāṇāṃ kṣayāya /
analyzed: te kṣipram eva anuttaryam spṛśanti yat uta āsravāṇām kṣayāya
translated: They quickly touch the unsurpassed, namely the destruction of the defilements.

original: evaṃ deśiteṣu vo bhikṣavo mayā dharmeṣu skandhānāṃ pravicayāya /
analyzed: evam deśiteṣu vaḥ bhikṣavaḥ mayā dharmeṣu skandhānām pravicayāya
translated: Thus, monks, I have taught you the dharmas for the analysis of the aggregates.

original: atha ca punar ihaikatyo rūpam ātmataḥ DhskD 🔽samanupaśyati /
analyzed: atha ca punar iha ekatyaḥ rūpam ātmataḥ  samanupaśyati
translated: Now, in this regard, someone regards form as the self,

original: yā sā samanupaśyanā saṃskārās te /
analyzed: yā sā samanupaśyanā saṃskārāḥ te
translated: and that regarding is a formation.

original: te punaḥ saṃskārāḥ kinnidānāḥ kiṃsamudayāḥ kiṃjātīyāḥ kiṃprabhavāḥ /
analyzed: te punar saṃskārāḥ kinnidānāḥ kiṃsamudayāḥ kiṃjātīyāḥ kiṃprabhavāḥ
translated: And those formations, what is their source, what is their origin, what is their birth, what is their arising?

original: avidyāsaṃsparśajaṃ bhikṣavo vedayitaṃ pratītya tṛṣṇotpannā /
analyzed: avidyā saṃsparśa jam bhikṣavaḥ vedayitam pratītya tṛṣṇā utpannā
translated: Monks, feeling born of contact with ignorance arises dependent on craving.

original: tatas te saṃskārās /🔽tṛṣṇā punar bhikṣavaḥ DhskD
analyzed: tatas te saṃskārāḥ  tṛṣṇā punar bhikṣavaḥ dhskd
translated: From that, those formations.

original: kinnidānā kiṃsamudayā kiṃjātīyā kiṃprabhavā /
analyzed: kinnidānā kiṃsamudayā kiṃjātīyā kiṃprabhavā
translated: And craving, monks, what is its source, what is its origin, what is its birth, what is its arising?

original: tṛṣṇā bhikṣavo vedanānidānā vedanāsamudayā vedanājātīyā vedanāprabhavā /
analyzed: tṛṣṇā bhikṣavaḥ vedanā nidānā vedanā samudayā vedanā jātīyā vedanā prabhavā
translated: Craving, monks, has feeling as its source, feeling as its origin, feeling as its birth, feeling as its arising.

original: vedanā punar bhikṣavaḥ kinnidānā kiṃsamudayā kiṃjātīyā kiṃprabhavā /🔽vedanā bhikṣavaḥ DhskD
analyzed: vedanā punar bhikṣavaḥ kinnidānā kiṃsamudayā kiṃjātīyā kiṃprabhavā  vedanā bhikṣavaḥ dhskd
translated: And feeling, monks, what is its source, what is its origin, what is its birth, what is its arising?

original: sparśanidānā sparśasamudayā sparśajātīyā sparśaprabhavā /
analyzed: sparśa nidānā sparśa samudayā sparśa jātīyā sparśa prabhavā
translated: Feeling, monks, has contact as its source, contact as its origin, contact as its birth, contact as its arising.

original: sparśaḥ kinnidānaḥ kiṃsamudayaḥ kiṃjātīyaḥ kiṃprabhavaḥ /
analyzed: sparśaḥ kinnidānaḥ kiṃsamudayaḥ kiṃjātīyaḥ kiṃprabhavaḥ
translated: And contact, what is its source, what is its origin, what is its birth, what is its arising?

original: sparśo bhikṣavaḥ ṣaḍāyatananidānaḥ ṣaḍāyatanasamudayaḥ ṣaḍāyatanajātīyaḥ DhskD
analyzed: sparśaḥ bhikṣavaḥ ṣaṣ āyatana nidānaḥ ṣaṣ āyatana samudayaḥ ṣaṣ āyatana jātīyaḥ dhskd
translated: Contact, monks, has the six sense bases as its source, the six sense bases as its origin, the six sense bases as its cause, the six sense bases as its condition.

original: ṣaḍāyatanaprabhavaḥ /
analyzed: ṣaṣ āyatana prabhavaḥ
translated: The six sense bases have contact as their source, the six sense bases as their origin, the six sense bases as their cause, the six sense bases as their condition.

original: tatra bhikṣavaḥ ṣaḍāyatanam anityaṃ saṃskṛtaṃ cetitaṃ pratītyasamutpannaṃ /
analyzed: tatra bhikṣavaḥ ṣaṣ āyatanam anityam saṃskṛtam cetitam pratītyasamutpannam
translated: There, monks, the six sense bases are impermanent, conditioned, dependently arisen,

original: so 'pi sparśaḥ sāpi vedanā sāpi tṛṣṇā sāpi samanupaśyanā anityā saṃskṛtā cetitā pratītyasamutpannā / DhskD
analyzed: sā u pi sparśaḥ sā api vedanā sā api tṛṣṇā sā api samanupaśyanā anityā saṃskṛtā cetitā pratītyasamutpannā
translated: that contact, that feeling, that craving, that view are impermanent, conditioned, dependently arisen.

original: sa rūpam ātmeti samanupaśyatīti satkāyadṛṣṭiparyavasthānam utpādayati /
analyzed: sa rūpam ātmā iti samanupaśyati iti satkāyadṛṣṭi paryavasthānam utpādayati
translated: He views form as the self, he produces the obsession of the view of the transitory collection.

original: sa tasmāt paryavasthānād anyat paryavasthānam utpādayati adhimātrād adhimātrataraṃ yāvat paripūrṇāt paripūrṇataraṃ DhskD /
analyzed: sa tasmāt paryavasthānāt anyat paryavasthānam utpādayati adhimātrāt adhimātrataram yāvat paripūrṇāt paripūrṇataram
translated: From that obsession he produces another obsession, more intense than the previous one, up to a complete one.

original: iti pūrvakaṃ paryavasthānaṃ tṛṣṇā paścimam upādānaṃ /
analyzed: iti pūrvakam paryavasthānam tṛṣṇā paścimam upādānam
translated: Thus the previous obsession is craving, the later one is grasping.

original: tad ucyate tṛṣṇāpratyayam upādānaṃ /🔽na haiva rūpam ātmeti samanupaśyaty api tu rūpavantam ātmānaṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tat ucyate tṛṣṇā pratyayam upādānam  na ha eva rūpam ātmā iti samanupaśyati api tu rūpavantam ātmānam samanupaśyati
translated: That is said to be grasping with craving as its condition.🔽He does not view form as the self, but he views the self as possessing form.🔽He does not view the self as possessing form, but he views the self in form.

original: na haiva rūpavantam ātmānaṃ saṃanupaśyaty api DhskD
analyzed: na ha eva rūpavantam ātmānam saṃanupaśyati api
translated: He does not view the self in form, but he views form in the self.

original: tu rūpam ātmīyaṃ samanupaśyati /🔽na haiva rūpam ātmīyaṃ samanupaśyaty api tu rūpe ātmānaṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tu rūpam ātmīyam samanupaśyati  na ha eva rūpam ātmīyam samanupaśyati api tu rūpe ātmānam samanupaśyati
translated: But he does not see form as his own.🔽He does not see form as his own, but he sees the self in form.

original: na haiva rūpe ātmānaṃ samanupaśyaty api tu vedanām ātmataḥ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na ha eva rūpe ātmānam samanupaśyati api tu vedanām ātmataḥ samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the self in form, but he sees feeling as the self.

original: na haiva vedanām ātmataḥ DhskD
analyzed: na ha eva vedanām ātmataḥ
translated: He does not see feeling as the self,

original: saṃanupaśyaty api tu vedanāvantam ātmānaṃ samanupaśyati /🔽na haiva vedanāvantaṃ ātmānaṃ samanupaśyaty api tu vedanām ātmīyāṃ samanupaśyati /🔽na haiva vedanām ātmīyāṃ samanupaśyaty api tu vedanāyām ātmānaṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: saṃanupaśyati api tu vedanāvantam ātmānam samanupaśyati  na ha eva vedanāvantam ātmānam samanupaśyati api tu vedanām ātmīyām samanupaśyati  na ha eva vedanām ātmīyām samanupaśyati api tu vedanāyām ātmānam samanupaśyati
translated: but he sees the self as possessing feeling.🔽He does not see the self as possessing feeling, but he sees feeling as his own.🔽He does not see feeling as his own, but he sees the self in feeling.

original: DhskD na haiva vedanāyām ātmānaṃ samanupaśyaty api tu saṃjñām ātmataḥ samanupaśyati /🔽na haiva saṃjñām ātmataḥ samanupaśyaty api tu saṃjñāvantam ātmānaṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na ha eva vedanāyām ātmānam samanupaśyati api tu saṃjñām ātmataḥ samanupaśyati  na ha eva saṃjñām ātmataḥ samanupaśyati api tu saṃjñāvantam ātmānam samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the self in feeling, but he sees perception as the self.🔽He does not see perception as the self, but he sees the self as possessing perception.

original: na haiva saṃjñāvantam ātmānaṃ samanupaśyaty api tu saṃjñām ātmīyāṃ DhskD 🔽samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na ha eva saṃjñāvantam ātmānam samanupaśyati api tu saṃjñām ātmīyām 🔽samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the self as possessing perception, but he sees perception as his own.

original: na haiva saṃjñām ātmīyāṃ samanupaśyaty api tu saṃjñāyām ātmānaṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na ha eva saṃjñām ātmīyām samanupaśyati api tu saṃjñāyām ātmānam samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see perception as his self, but he sees the self as having perception.

original: na haiva saṃjñāyām ātmānaṃ samanupaśyaty api tu saṃskārān ātmataḥ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na ha eva saṃjñāyām ātmānam samanupaśyati api tu saṃskārān ātmataḥ samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the self as having perception, but he sees formations as the self.

original: na haiva saṃskārān ātmataḥ DhskD
analyzed: na ha eva saṃskārān ātmataḥ
translated: He does not see formations as the self,

original: samanupaśyaty api tu saṃskāravantam ātmānaṃ samanupaśyati / vistaraḥ /
analyzed: samanupaśyati api tu saṃskāravantam ātmānam samanupaśyati vistaraḥ
translated: but he sees the self as having formations.

original: vijñānam ātmataḥ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: vijñānam ātmataḥ samanupaśyati
translated: He sees consciousness as the self.

original: na haiva vijñānam ātmataḥ samanupaśyaty api tu vijñānavantam ātmānaṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na ha eva vijñānam ātmataḥ samanupaśyati api tu vijñānavantam ātmānam samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see consciousness as the self, but he sees the self as having consciousness.

original: na haiva vijñānavantam ātmānaṃ DhskD
analyzed: na ha eva vijñānavantam ātmānam dhskd
translated: He does not see the self as having consciousness,

original: samanupaśyati api tu vijñānam ātmīyaṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: samanupaśyati api tu vijñānam ātmīyam samanupaśyati
translated: but he sees consciousness as his own.

original: na haiva vijñānam ātmīyaṃ samanupaśyaty api tu vijñāne ātmānaṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na ha eva vijñānam ātmīyam samanupaśyati api tu vijñāne ātmānam samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see consciousness as his own, but he sees the self in consciousness.

original: na haiva vijñāne ātmānaṃ samanupaśyaty api tu kāṃkṣī bhavati vicikitsī /
analyzed: na ha eva vijñāne ātmānam samanupaśyati api tu kāṃkṣī bhavati vicikitsī
translated: He does not see the self in consciousness, but he becomes doubtful and uncertain.

original: na haiva kāṃkṣī bhavati vicikitsī api DhskD
analyzed: na ha eva kāṃkṣī bhavati vicikitsī api
translated: He does not become doubtful and uncertain,🔽but he becomes one who is not free from doubt.

original: tu bhavadṛṣṭir bhavati vibhavadṛṣṭiḥ /
analyzed: tu bhava dṛṣṭiḥ bhavati vibhava dṛṣṭiḥ
translated: One has a view of existence as a view of non-existence.

original: na haiva bhavadṛṣṭir bhavati vibhavadṛṣṭiḥ api tv astīti vācādhigataṃ bhavaty /
analyzed: na ha eva bhava dṛṣṭiḥ bhavati vibhava dṛṣṭiḥ api tu asti iti vācā adhigatam bhavati
translated: One does not have a view of existence as a view of non-existence, but rather one has verbally attained 'it exists'.

original: ayam aham asmīti samanupaśyati /🔽yo 'sāv asmīty adhigamo 'yam aham asmīty adhigamo /
analyzed: ayam aham asmi iti samanupaśyati  yaḥ sau asmi iti adhigamaḥ yam aham asmi iti
translated: One sees 'I am this'.🔽The attainment of 'I am' is the attainment of 'I am this'.

original: yāsāv asmīti samanupaśyanā DhskD
analyzed: yā asau asmi iti samanupaśyanā
translated: The insight of 'I am'

original: saṃskārās te /
analyzed: saṃskārāḥ te
translated: are those formations.

original: te punaḥ saṃskārāḥ kiṃnidānāḥ kiṃsamudayāḥ kiṃjātīyāḥ kiṃprabhavā /
analyzed: te punar saṃskārāḥ kiṃnidānāḥ kiṃsamudayāḥ kiṃjātīyāḥ kiṃprabhavāḥ
translated: Moreover, those formations have what as their source, what as their origin, what as their birth, what as their arising?

original: vistareṇa yāvat /
analyzed: vistareṇa yāvat
translated: In detail, up to...

original: tatra bhikṣavaḥ ṣaḍāyatanam anityaṃ saṃskṛtaṃ cetitaṃ pratītyasamutpannaṃ /
analyzed: tatra bhikṣavaḥ ṣaṣ āyatanam anityam saṃskṛtam cetitam pratītyasamutpannam
translated: There, monks, the six sense bases are impermanent, conditioned, dependently arisen,

original: so 'pi sparśaḥ sāpi vedanā sāpi tṛṣṇā DhskD
analyzed: sā u pi sparśaḥ sā api vedanā sā api tṛṣṇā
translated: that contact, that feeling, that craving,

original: te 'pi saṃskārāḥ sāpi samanupaśyanā anityā saṃskṛtā cetitā pratītyasamutpannā asmīty adhigatā bhavaty /
analyzed: te pi saṃskārāḥ sā api samanupaśyanā anityā saṃskṛtā cetitā pratītyasamutpannā asmi iti adhigatā bhavati
translated: those formations, and that insight are impermanent, conditioned, dependently arisen. The attainment of 'I am' is seen.

original: ayam aham asmīti saṃanupaśyati /
analyzed: ayam aham asmi iti saṃanupaśyati
translated: One sees 'I am this'.

original: satkāyadṛṣṭiparyavasthānaṃ utpādayati /
analyzed: satkāya dṛṣṭi paryavasthānam utpādayati
translated: One produces the obsession of the view of the real existence of the body.

original: sa tasmāt paryavasthānād anyat DhskD
analyzed: sa tasmāt paryavasthānāt anyat
translated: From that obsession, one has another insight.

original: paryavasthānam utpādayati adhimātrād adhimātrataraṃ tīvrāt tīvrataraṃ paripūrṇāt paripūrṇataraṃ /
analyzed: paryavasthānam utpādayati adhimātrāt adhimātrataram tīvrāt tīvrataram paripūrṇāt paripūrṇataram
translated: It produces a higher and higher, more and more intense, and more and more complete envelopment from a higher, more intense, and more complete [form of craving].

original: iti pūrvakaṃ paryavasthānaṃ trṣṇā paścimam upādānaṃ /
analyzed: iti pūrvakam paryavasthānam trṣṇā paścimam upādānam
translated: Thus, the previous envelopment is craving, and the subsequent grasping.

original: tad ucyate tṛṣṇāpratyayam upādānaṃ /
analyzed: tat ucyate tṛṣṇā pratyayam upādānam
translated: That is said to be grasping with craving as its condition.

original: api khalu śāśvato lokaḥ DhskD
analyzed: api khalu śāśvataḥ lokaḥ dhskd
translated: Moreover, the world is eternal.

original: antagrāhadṛṣṭiparyavasthānam utpādayaty adhimātrād adhimātrataraṃ yāvat paripūrṇāt paripūrṇataram /
analyzed: anta grāha dṛṣṭi paryavasthānam utpādayati adhimātrāt adhimātrataram yāvat paripūrṇāt paripūrṇataram
translated: The envelopment of the view of grasping extremes produces a higher and higher, more and more intense, and more and more complete envelopment from a higher, more intense, and more complete [form of craving].

original: iti pūrvakaṃ paryavasthānaṃ tṛṣṇā paścimakam upādānaṃ /
analyzed: iti pūrvakam paryavasthānam tṛṣṇā paścimakam upādānam
translated: Thus, the previous envelopment is craving, and the subsequent grasping.

original: tad ucyate tṛṣṇāpratyayam upādānaṃ /
analyzed: tat ucyate tṛṣṇā pratyayam upādānam
translated: That is said to be grasping with craving as its condition.

original: aśāśvato DhskD lokaḥ /🔽śāśvataś cāśāśvataś ca /
analyzed: aśāśvataḥ dhskd lokaḥ  śāśvataḥ ca a śāśvataḥ ca
translated: The world is not eternal.🔽The world is both eternal and not eternal.

original: naiva śāśvato nāśāśvataḥ /
analyzed: na eva śāśvataḥ na a śāśvataḥ
translated: The world is neither eternal nor not eternal.

original: antavān lokaḥ /
analyzed: antavān lokaḥ
translated: The world has an end.

original: anantavān lokaḥ /🔽antavāṃś cānantavāṃś ca /
analyzed: anantavān lokaḥ  antavān ca anantavān ca
translated: The world has no end.🔽The world both has an end and has no end.

original: naivāntavān anantavāṃś ca /🔽sa jīvas tac charīraṃ /
analyzed: na eva antavān anantavān ca  sa jīvaḥ tat śarīram
translated: The world neither has an end nor has no end.🔽The soul and the body are the same.

original: anyo jīvo 'nyac charīraṃ bhavati /🔽tathāgataḥ paraṃ maraṇān na bhavati /
analyzed: anyaḥ jīvaḥ nyat śarīram bhavati  tathāgataḥ param maraṇāt na bhavati
translated: The soul and the body are different.🔽The Tathagata does not exist after death.

original: tathāgataḥ DhskD
analyzed: tathāgataḥ
translated: The Tathagata exists and does not exist after death.🔽The Tathagata neither exists nor does not exist after death.

original: paraṃ maraṇād bhavati ca na bhavati ca /
analyzed: param maraṇāt bhavati ca na bhavati ca
translated: After death, he exists and does not exist.

original: naiva bhavati na na bhavati paraṃ maraṇād /
analyzed: na eva bhavati na na bhavati param maraṇāt
translated: After death, he neither exists nor does not exist.

original: antagrāhadṛṣṭiparyavasthānam utpādayati /
analyzed: anta grāha dṛṣṭi paryavasthānam utpādayati
translated: He generates the latent tendency of the extreme views.

original: sa tasmāt paryavasthānād yāvat paripūrṇāt paripūrṇataraṃ /
analyzed: sa tasmāt paryavasthānāt yāvat paripūrṇāt paripūrṇataram
translated: From that latent tendency, up to the complete, more complete.

original: iti pūrvakaṃ paryavasthānaṃ tṛṣṇā paścimakam DhskD upādānaṃ /
analyzed: iti pūrvakam paryavasthānam tṛṣṇā paścimakam dhskd upādānam
translated: Thus, the previous latent tendency is craving, the later is grasping.

original: tad ucyate tṛṣṇāpratyayam upādānaṃ /
analyzed: tat ucyate tṛṣṇā pratyayam upādānam
translated: That is said to be grasping with craving as its condition.

original: api khalu na bhagavāṃs tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho na vidyācaraṇasaṃpanno na
analyzed: api khalu na bhagavān tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ na vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ na
translated: Moreover, the Blessed One is not a Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One, not one who has knowledge and conduct, not

original: sugato lokavid anuttaraḥ puruṣadaṃyasārathi śāstā devamanuṣyāṇāṃ buddho bhagavāṃ🔽mithyā dṛṣṭiparyavasthānaṃ DhskD
analyzed: sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa daṃya sārathi śāstā deva manuṣyāṇām buddhaḥ bhagavān  mithyā dṛṣṭi paryavasthānam
translated: a Well-Gone One, a Knower of the World, an Unsurpassed One, a Trainer of those to be tamed, a Teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, a Blessed One.

original: utpādayati /
analyzed: utpādayati
translated: He generates the latent tendency of wrong views.

original: sa tasmāt paryavasthānād vistareṇa paripūrṇāt paripūrṇataraṃ /
analyzed: sa tasmāt paryavasthānāt vistareṇa paripūrṇāt paripūrṇataram
translated: From that latent tendency, in detail, from the complete, more complete.

original: tad ucyate tṛṣṇāpratyayam upādānaṃ /
analyzed: tat ucyate tṛṣṇā pratyayam upādānam
translated: That is said to be grasping with craving as its condition.

original: na svākhyāto bhagavato dharmo na sāṃdṛṣṭiko na nirjvaraḥ nākālikaḥ naupanāyiko naihipaśyakaḥ DhskD
analyzed: na su ākhyātaḥ bhagavataḥ dharmaḥ na sāṃdṛṣṭikaḥ na nirjvaraḥ na akālikaḥ na aupanāyikaḥ na aihipaśyakaḥ
translated: The Blessed One's Dharma is not well-proclaimed, not seen, not free from fever, not timely, not leading to Nibbāna, not to be personally experienced by the wise.

original: na pratyātmavedanīyo vijñair /
analyzed: na pratyātma vedanīyaḥ vijñaiḥ
translated: It is not to be personally experienced by the wise.

original: na supratipanno bhagavataḥ śrāvakasaṃgho na ṛjupratipanno na nyāyapratipanno na sāmīcīpratipanno nānudharmacārī /
analyzed: na su pratipannaḥ bhagavataḥ śrāvaka saṃghaḥ na ṛju pratipannaḥ na nyāya pratipannaḥ na sāmīcī pratipannaḥ na anudharma cārī
translated: The Blessed One's Saṅgha of disciples is not practicing well, not practicing straightforwardly, not practicing rightly, not practicing properly, not practicing in accordance with the Dharma.

original: na duḥkhaṃ / na samudayo /
analyzed: na duḥkham na samudayaḥ
translated: There is no suffering. There is no origination.

original: na nirodho / na mārgo /
analyzed: na nirodhaḥ na mārgaḥ
translated: There is no cessation. There is no path.

original: na sarvasaṃskārā DhskD anityā /
analyzed: na sarva saṃskārā dhskd anityā
translated: All conditioned things are not impermanent.

original: na sarvadharmā anātmāno /
analyzed: na sarva dharmāḥ anātmānaḥ
translated: All dharmas are not without self.

original: na śāntaṃ nirvāṇam /
analyzed: na śāntam nirvāṇam
translated: Nirvāṇa is not peace.

original: iti mithyādṛṣṭiparyavasthānam utpādayati /
analyzed: iti mithyādṛṣṭi paryavasthānam utpādayati
translated: Thus he produces the enveloping of wrong view.

original: sa tasmāt paryavasthānād anyat paryavasthānam utpādayati /
analyzed: sa tasmāt paryavasthānāt anyat paryavasthānam utpādayati
translated: From that enveloping he produces another enveloping,

original: vistareṇa yāvad /
analyzed: vistareṇa yāvat
translated: in detail up to

original: iti pūrvakaṃ paryavasthānaṃ DhskD
analyzed: iti pūrvakam paryavasthānam
translated: Thus the previous enveloping

original: tṛṣṇā paścimam upādānaṃ /
analyzed: tṛṣṇā paścimam upādānam
translated: is craving, and the latter is clinging.

original: tad ucyate tṛṣṇāpratyayam upādānam iti /
analyzed: tat ucyate tṛṣṇā pratyayam upādānam iti
translated: That is called 'clinging with craving as its condition.'

original: api khalu śāśvato loka idam eva satyaṃ moham anyad /
analyzed: api khalu śāśvataḥ lokaḥ idam eva satyam moham anyat
translated: Moreover, 'the world is eternal' - this alone is true, the other is delusion.

original: iti dṛṣṭiparāmarśaparyavasthānam utpādayati /🔽sa tasmāt paryavasthānād anyat paryavasthānam DhskD
analyzed: iti dṛṣṭi parāmarśa paryavasthānam utpādayati  sa tasmāt paryavasthānāt anyat paryavasthānam
translated: Thus he produces the enveloping of clinging to views.

original: utpādayati /
analyzed: utpādayati
translated: From that enveloping he produces another enveloping,

original: vistareṇa yāvat paścimakam upādānaṃ /
analyzed: vistareṇa yāvat paścimakam upādānam
translated: in detail up to the latter clinging.

original: tad ucyate tṛṣṇāpratyayam upādānaṃ /
analyzed: tat ucyate tṛṣṇā pratyayam upādānam
translated: That is said to be clinging with craving as its condition.

original: śāśvato loko vistareṇa yāvac caiva bhavati tathāgataḥ paraṃ maraṇād iti idam eva satyaṃ mohaṃ anyad /
analyzed: śāśvataḥ lokaḥ vistareṇa yāvat ca eva bhavati tathāgataḥ param maraṇāt iti idam eva satyam moham anyat
translated: The world is eternal up to The Tathāgata exists after death - this alone is true, the other is delusion.

original: DhskD iti dṛṣṭiparāmarśaparyavasthānam utpādayati /
analyzed: iti dṛṣṭi parāmarśa paryavasthānam utpādayati
translated: This is the over-indulgence in false views.

original: sa tasmāt paryavasthānād anyat paryavasthānam utpādayati /
analyzed: sa tasmāt paryavasthānāt anyat paryavasthānam utpādayati
translated: From that over-indulgence, he produces another over-indulgence.

original: vistareṇa yāvat paścimakam upādānaṃ /
analyzed: vistareṇa yāvat paścimakam upādānam
translated: Up to the last clinging.

original: tad ucyate tṛṣṇāpratyayaṃ upādānaṃ /
analyzed: tat ucyate tṛṣṇā pratyayam upādānam
translated: That is said to be clinging with craving as its condition.

original: api khalu śīlaṃ parāmṛśati DhskD
analyzed: api khalu śīlam parāmṛśati
translated: Moreover, he over-indulges in morality and vows.

original: śīlena śucyati mucyati niryāti sukhaduḥkhaṃ vyatikrāmati sukhaduḥkhavyatikramaṃ cānuprāpnoti /
analyzed: śīlena śucyati mucyati niryāti sukha duḥkham vyatikrāmati sukha duḥkha vyatikramam ca anuprāpnoti
translated: By morality, he is purified, liberated, goes forth, transcends pleasure and pain, and attains the transcendence of pleasure and pain.

original: śīlavrataparāmarśaparyavasthānam utpādayati /
analyzed: śīla vrata parāmarśa paryavasthānam utpādayati
translated: He produces the over-indulgence in clinging to morality and vows.

original: sa tasmāt paryavasthānād anyat paryavasthānaṃ utpādayati DhskD /
analyzed: sa tasmāt paryavasthānāt anyat paryavasthānam utpādayati
translated: From that over-indulgence, he produces another over-indulgence.

original: vistareṇa yāvat paścimakaṃ upādānaṃ /
analyzed: vistareṇa yāvat paścimakam upādānam
translated: Up to the last clinging.

original: tad ucyate tṛṣṇāpratyayam upādānaṃ /
analyzed: tat ucyate tṛṣṇā pratyayam upādānam
translated: That is said to be clinging with craving as its condition.

original: vrataṃ parāmṛśati yad ubhayataḥ śīlavrataṃ parāmṛśati /
analyzed: vratam parāmṛśati yat ubhayatas śīla vratam parāmṛśati
translated: He over-indulges in vows - what is on both sides. He over-indulges in morality and vows.

original: śīlavratena śucyati mucyate niryāti yāvat sukhaduḥkhaṃ vyatikramam anuprāpnoti DhskD /
analyzed: śīla vratena śucyati mucyate niryāti yāvat sukha duḥkham vyatikramam anuprāpnoti
translated: One becomes pure, is liberated, goes forth, up to one attains happiness and suffering, and crosses over.

original: śīlavrataparāmarśaparyavasthānam utpādayati /
analyzed: śīla vrata parāmarśa paryavasthānam utpādayati
translated: One produces the enveloping of clinging to rules and rituals.

original: sa tasmāt paryavasthānād anyat paryavasthānam utpādayati /
analyzed: sa tasmāt paryavasthānāt anyat paryavasthānam utpādayati
translated: From that enveloping, one produces another enveloping.

original: vistareṇa yāvat paścimakam upādānaṃ /
analyzed: vistareṇa yāvat paścimakam upādānam
translated: In detail, up to the last grasping.

original: tad ucyate tṛṣṇāpratyayam upādānaṃ /🔽api khalu tathāgato bhagavān arhan samyaksaṃbuddho DhskD
analyzed: tat ucyate tṛṣṇā pratyayam upādānam  api khalu tathāgataḥ bhagavān arhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ dhskd
translated: That is called grasping with craving as a condition.

original: neti vicikitsāparyavasthānam utpādayati /
analyzed: na iti vicikitsā paryavasthānam utpādayati
translated: Moreover, the Tathāgata, the Blessed One, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, the One with Wisdom and Conduct, the Sugata, the Knower of the World, the Leader of Men to be Tamed, the Teacher of Gods and Men, the Buddha, the Blessed One, is not the One with Wisdom and Conduct, the Sugata, the Knower of the World, the Leader of Men to be Tamed, the Teacher of Gods and Men, the Buddha, the Blessed One.🔽One produces the enveloping of doubt.

original: sa tasmāt paryavasthānād anyaṃ paryavasthānam utpādayati /
analyzed: sa tasmāt paryavasthānāt anyam paryavasthānam utpādayati
translated: From that enveloping, one produces another enveloping.

original: vistareṇa yāvat paścimakaṃ upādānaṃ /
analyzed: vistareṇa yāvat paścimakam upādānam
translated: In detail, up to the last grasping.

original: tad ucyate tṛṣṇāpratyayam upādānaṃ /🔽vidyācaraṇasaṃpanno na vidyācaraṇasaṃpannaḥ DhskD /
analyzed: tat ucyate tṛṣṇā pratyayam upādānam  vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ na vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ
translated: That is called grasping with craving as a condition.

original: sugato lokavit na sugato lokavit /🔽anuttaro nānuttaraḥ /🔽puruṣadamyasārathiḥ na puruṣadamyasārathiḥ /
analyzed: sugataḥ loka vid na sugataḥ loka vid  anuttaraḥ na anuttaraḥ  puruṣa damya sārathiḥ na puruṣa damya sārathiḥ
translated: The One with Wisdom and Conduct, the Sugata, the Knower of the World, the Leader of Men to be Tamed, the Teacher of Gods and Men, the Buddha, the Blessed One, is not the One with Wisdom and Conduct, the Sugata, the Knower of the World, the Leader of Men to be Tamed, the Teacher of Gods and Men, the Buddha, the Blessed One.

original: śāstā devamanuṣyāṇāṃ na śāstā devamanuṣyāṇāṃ /
analyzed: śāstā deva manuṣyāṇām na śāstā deva manuṣyāṇām
translated: The Unsurpassed, the Supreme, the Leader of Men to be Tamed, the Teacher of Gods and Men, the Buddha, the Blessed One, is not the Unsurpassed, the Supreme, the Leader of Men to be Tamed, the Teacher of Gods and Men, the Buddha, the Blessed One.

original: buddho bhagavān na buddho bhagavān /
analyzed: buddhaḥ bhagavān na buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: The Buddha is the Blessed One, the Buddha is not the Blessed One.

original: DhskD svākhyāto bhagavato dharmo na svākhyāto bhagavato dharmaḥ /
analyzed: su su ākhyātaḥ bhagavataḥ dharmaḥ na su ākhyātaḥ bhagavataḥ dharmaḥ
translated: The Dharma of the Blessed One is well-proclaimed, the Dharma of the Blessed One is not well-proclaimed.

original: sāṃdṛṣṭiko na sāṃdṛṣṭiko /
analyzed: sāṃdṛṣṭikaḥ na sāṃdṛṣṭikaḥ
translated: It is to be seen for oneself, it is not to be seen for oneself.

original: nirjvaro na nirjvaraḥ /
analyzed: nirjvaraḥ na nirjvaraḥ
translated: It is free from fever, it is not free from fever.

original: ākāliko nākālikaḥ /🔽aupanāyiko naupanāyikaḥ /
analyzed: ākālikaḥ na ākālikaḥ  aupanāyikaḥ na aupanāyikaḥ
translated: It is timely, it is not timely.🔽It leads to liberation, it does not lead to liberation.

original: aihidarśiko naihidarśikaḥ /
analyzed: aihidarśikaḥ naihidarśikaḥ
translated: It is to be seen here, it is not to be seen here.

original: pratyātmavedanīyo DhskD
analyzed: pratyātma vedanīyaḥ
translated: The Dharma is to be experienced individually,

original: vijñaiḥ na pratyātmavedanīyo vijñaiḥ /
analyzed: vijñaiḥ na pratyātma vedanīyaḥ vijñaiḥ
translated: the Dharma is not to be experienced individually by the wise.

original: supratipanno bhagavataḥ śrāvakasaṃgho na supratipanno bhagavataḥ śrāvakasaṃghaḥ /🔽ṛjupratipanno na ṛjupratipanno /
analyzed: su pratipannaḥ bhagavataḥ śrāvaka saṃghaḥ na su pratipannaḥ bhagavataḥ śrāvaka saṃghaḥ  ṛju pratipannaḥ naḥ ṛju pratipannaḥ
translated: The Sangha of the Blessed One's disciples practices well, the Sangha of the Blessed One's disciples does not practice well.🔽They practice straight, they do not practice straight.

original: nyāyapratipanno na nyāyapratipanno DhskD /
analyzed: nyāya pratipannaḥ na nyāya pratipannaḥ
translated: They practice rightly, they do not practice rightly.

original: dharmānudharmapratipanno na dharmānudharmapratipannaḥ /
analyzed: dharma anudharma pratipannaḥ na dharma anudharma pratipannaḥ
translated: They practice in accordance with the Dharma, they do not practice in accordance with the Dharma.

original: sāmīcīpratipanno na sāmīcīpratipannaḥ /
analyzed: sāmīcī pratipannaḥ na sāmīcī pratipannaḥ
translated: They practice properly, they do not practice properly.

original: anudharmacārī nānudharmacārī /
analyzed: anudharma cārī na anudharma cārī
translated: They practice in accordance with the Dharma, they do not practice in accordance with the Dharma.

original: duḥkhaṃ na duḥkhaṃ /🔽samudayo na samudayo /
analyzed: duḥkham na duḥkham  samudayaḥ na
translated: Suffering is not suffering.🔽Origination is not origination.

original: nirodho na nirodhaḥ /
analyzed: nirodhaḥ na nirodhaḥ
translated: Cessation is not cessation.

original: mārgo na mārgaḥ /🔽sarvasaṃskārā DhskD
analyzed: mārgaḥ na mārgaḥ  sarva saṃskārāḥ dhskd
translated: The path is not the path.🔽All conditioned things are impermanent,

original: anityā na sarvasaṃskārā anityāḥ /
analyzed: anityāḥ na sarva saṃskārāḥ anityāḥ
translated: all conditioned things are not impermanent.

original: sarvadharmā anātmānaḥ na sarvadharmā anātmānaḥ /
analyzed: sarva dharmāḥ anātmānaḥ na sarva dharmāḥ anātmānaḥ
translated: All dharmas are without self, not all dharmas are without self.

original: śāntaṃ nirvāṇaṃ na śāntaṃ nirvāṇaṃ /
analyzed: śāntam nirvāṇam na śāntam nirvāṇam
translated: Nirvāṇa is peaceful, nirvāṇa is not peaceful.

original: iti vicikitsāparyavasthānam utpādayati /
analyzed: iti vicikitsā paryavasthānam utpādayati
translated: Thus he produces the hindrance of doubt.

original: vistareṇa yāvat paścimakam upādānam /
analyzed: vistareṇa yāvat paścimakam upādānam
translated: In detail, up to the last grasping.

original: DhskD tad ucyate tṛṣṇāpratyayam upādānaṃ /
analyzed: tat ucyate tṛṣṇā pratyayam upādānam
translated: That is said to be grasping with craving as a condition.

original: api khalu sarvāṇy eva catvāry upādānāni tṛṣṇāsamudayāni tṛṣṇājātīyāni tṛṣṇāprabhavāni /
analyzed: api khalu sarvāṇi eva catvāri upādānāni tṛṣṇā samudayāni tṛṣṇā jātīyāni tṛṣṇā prabhavāni
translated: Moreover, all four graspings arise from craving, are of the nature of craving, and originate from craving.

original: katamāni catvāri /
analyzed: katamāni catvāri
translated: Which four?

original: kāmopādānaṃ dṛṣṭyupādānaṃ śīlavratopādānam ātmavādopādānaṃ DhskD /
analyzed: kāma upādānam dṛṣṭi upādānam śīla vrata upādānam ātma vāda upādānam
translated: The grasping of sensual desire, the grasping of views, the grasping of morality and spiritual practices, and the grasping of self-theories.

original: kāmopādānaṃ katamad /
analyzed: kāma upādānam katamat
translated: What is the grasping of sensual desire?

original: āha /
analyzed: āha
translated: He says:

original: kāmapratisaṃyuktāṃ dṛṣṭiṃ śīlavrataṃ ca sthāpya yāni tadanyāni kāmapratisaṃyuktāni saṃyojanabandhanānuśayopakleśaparyavasthānāni idam ucyate 🔽DhskD
analyzed: kāma pratisaṃyuktām dṛṣṭim śīla vratam ca sthāpya yāni tad anyāni kāma pratisaṃyuktāni saṃyojana bandhana anuśaya upakleśa paryavasthānāni idam ucyate  dhskd
translated: Except for the views, morality and spiritual practices connected with sensual desire, the other fetters, bonds, latent tendencies, secondary afflictions, and hindrances connected with sensual desire - this is said to be

original: kāmopādānaṃ /
analyzed: kāma upādānam
translated: the grasping of sensual desire.

original: dṛṣṭyupādānaṃ katamad /
analyzed: dṛṣṭi upādānam katamat
translated: What is the grasping of views?

original: āha /
analyzed: āha
translated: He says:

original: catasro dṛṣṭayo dṛṣṭyupādānam ity ucyate satkāyadṛṣṭir antagrāhadṛṣṭir mithyādṛṣṭir dṛṣṭiparāmarśa itīmāś catasro dṛṣṭayo /
analyzed: catasraḥ dṛṣṭayaḥ dṛṣṭi upādānam iti ucyate sat kāya dṛṣṭiḥ anta grāha dṛṣṭiḥ mithyādṛṣṭiḥ dṛṣṭi parāmarśaḥ iti imāḥ catasraḥ dṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: The four views are called the clinging to views. They are the view of the transitory collection, the extreme views, the view of holding one's own view as supreme, and the view of holding one's own morality and asceticism as supreme.

original: dṛṣṭyupādānam ity ucyate /
analyzed: dṛṣṭi upādānam iti ucyate
translated: These four views are called the clinging to views.

original: śīlavratopādānaṃ katamad /
analyzed: śīla vrata upādānam katamat
translated: What is the clinging to morality and asceticism?

original: yathā DhskD khalv ihaikatyaḥ śīlaṃ parāmṛśati vistareṇa yāvat /
analyzed: yathā khalu iha ekatyaḥ śīlam parāmṛśati vistareṇa yāvat
translated: As it is said in the Abhidharma-kośa, Here, someone clings to morality and asceticism, in detail up to...

original: ubhayena śīlavratena śucyati mucyate niryāti sukhaduḥkhaṃ vyatikrāmati sukhaduḥkhavyatikramam anuprāpnoti /
analyzed: ubhayena śīla vratena śucyati mucyate niryāti sukha duḥkham vyatikrāmati sukha duḥkha vyatikramam anuprāpnoti
translated: By both morality and asceticism, one becomes pure, liberated, goes forth, transcends happiness and suffering, and attains the transcendence of happiness and suffering.

original: idam ucyate śīlavratopādānaṃ /🔽ātmavratopādānam DhskD
analyzed: idam ucyate śīla vrata upādānam  ātma vrata upādānam
translated: This is called the clinging to morality and asceticism.🔽The clinging to morality and asceticism is explained in the Abhidharma-kośa.

original: ātmavādopādānaṃ katamat /
analyzed: ātmavāda upādānam katamat
translated: What is the clinging to one's own view as supreme?

original: rūpārūpyapratisaṃyuktāṃ dṛṣṭiṃ śīlavrataṃ ca sthāpya tadanyāni rūpārūpyapratisaṃyuktāni saṃyojanabandhanānuśayopakleśaparyavasthānānīdam ucyate
analyzed: rūpa ārūpya pratisaṃyuktām dṛṣṭim śīla vratam ca sthāpya tad anyāni rūpa ārūpya pratisaṃyuktāni saṃyojana bandhana anuśaya upakleśa paryavasthānāni idam ucyate
translated: Excluding the views and morality and asceticism associated with the form and formless realms, the other fetters, bonds, latent tendencies, afflictions, and envelopments associated with the form and formless realms are called

original: ātmavādopādānaṃ /
analyzed: ātma vāda upādānam
translated: the clinging to one's own view as supreme.

original: DhskD api khalv evam uktaṃ bhagavatā mahānidāne vyākaraṇe āyuṣmaty ānande /
analyzed: api khalu evam uktam bhagavatā mahānidāne vyākaraṇe āyuṣmati ānande
translated: Moreover, it is said by the Blessed One in the Mahānidāna-vyākaraṇa Sūtra to the Venerable Ānanda:

original: asti pratyayam ānandopādānaṃ vistareṇa yāvat /
analyzed: asti pratyayam ānanda upādānam vistareṇa yāvat
translated: There is a condition, Ananda, for clinging, in detail up to:

original: tṛṣṇā ced ānanda nābhaviṣyad api nu kasya cit kā cit tṛṣṇābhaviṣyan /
analyzed: tṛṣṇā ced ānanda na abhaviṣyat api nu kasya cit kā cit tṛṣṇā abhaviṣyan
translated: If craving did not exist at all, in any way, would clinging be discerned?

original: no bhadanta /🔽sarvaśo vā punar ānanda DhskD
analyzed: no bhadanta  sarvaśas vā punar ānanda
translated: No, Venerable Sir.🔽Or, Ananda, if craving were completely and totally absent,

original: tṛṣṇāyām asatyām api nu upādānaṃ prajñāpayeta /
analyzed: tṛṣṇāyām asatyām api nu upādānam prajñāpayeta
translated: would clinging be discerned?

original: no bhadanta /
analyzed: no bhadanta
translated: No, Venerable Sir.

original: tasmāt tarhy ānanda etan nidānam eṣa hetur eṣa samudaya eṣa pratyayaḥ upādānasya yad uta tṛṣṇā tṛṣṇāpratyayam upādānaṃ /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi ānandaḥ etat nidānam eṣa hetuḥ eṣa samudayaḥ eṣa pratyayaḥ upādānasya yat uta tṛṣṇā tṛṣṇā pratyayam upādānam
translated: Therefore, Ananda, this is the source, this is the origin, this is the birth, this is the arising of clinging, namely craving. Craving is the condition for clinging.

original: iti DhskD yad uktam idaṃ me tat pratyuktam iti //
analyzed: iti dhskd yat uktam idam me tat pratyuktam iti
translated: Thus, Ananda, what was said by me: 'This has been answered by me,' this is the answer.

original: upādānapratyayo bhavaḥ
analyzed: upādāna pratyayaḥ bhavaḥ
translated: Existence with clinging as condition

original: bhavaḥ katama /
analyzed: bhavaḥ katama
translated: What is existence?

original: āha /
analyzed: āha
translated: It is said:

original: upādānāny eva pratītyānekavidhā bhavaprajñaptir uktā bhagavatā /
analyzed: upādānāni eva pratītya anekavidhā bhava prajñaptiḥ uktā bhagavatā
translated: The Blessed One has declared the designation of existence in many ways, depending on the clingings.

original: ekavidhā asti bhavaprajñaptir yatra traidhātukāḥ paṃca skandhā uktā bhagavatā /
analyzed: ekavidhā asti bhava prajñaptiḥ yatra traidhātukāḥ paṃca skandhāḥ uktāḥ bhagavatā
translated: There is a one-fold designation of existence where the Blessed One has spoken of the five aggregates in the three realms.

original: DhskD asti bhavaprajñaptir yatrāyatyāṃ punarbhavābhinirvartakaṃ karmoktaṃ bhagavatā /
analyzed: asti bhava prajñaptiḥ yatra āyatyām punarbhava abhinirvartakam karma uktam bhagavatā
translated: There is a designation of existence where the Blessed One has spoken of the action that brings about rebirth in the future.

original: asti bhavaprajñaptir yatropapattyaṃgikā paṃca skandhā uktā bhagavatā /
analyzed: asti bhava prajñaptiḥ yatra upapatti aṃgikā paṃca skandhāḥ uktāḥ bhagavatā
translated: There is a designation of existence where the five aggregates with the members of rebirth are said to be existence by the Blessed One.

original: katamā bhavaprajñaptir yatra traidhātukāḥ paṃca skandhā bhavā uktā DhskD bhagavatā /
analyzed: katamā bhava prajñaptiḥ yatra traidhātukāḥ paṃca skandhāḥ bhavāḥ uktāḥ bhagavatā
translated: What is the designation of existence where the five aggregates of the three realms are said to be existences by the Blessed One?

original: yad uktaṃ /
analyzed: yat uktam
translated: It is said:

original: trayo bhavāḥ kāmabhavo rūpabhavaḥ ārūpyabhavaḥ /
analyzed: trayaḥ bhavāḥ kāma bhavaḥ rūpa bhavaḥ ārūpya bhavaḥ
translated: There are three existences: the existence of desire, the existence of form, and the existence of the formless.

original: iyaṃ bhavaprajñaptir yatra traidhātukāḥ paṃca skandhā bhava uktā bhagavatā /
analyzed: iyam bhava prajñaptiḥ yatra traidhātukāḥ paṃca skandhāḥ bhavaḥ uktāḥ bhagavatā
translated: This is the designation of existence where the five aggregates of the three realms are said to be existences by the Blessed One.

original: katamā bhavaprajñaptir yatrāyatyāṃ punarbhavābhinirvartakaṃ karmoktaṃ bhagavatā DhskD /
analyzed: katamā bhava prajñaptiḥ yatra āyatyām punarbhava abhinirvartakam karma uktam bhagavatā
translated: What is the designation of existence where the karma that brings about rebirth in the future is said to be existence by the Blessed One?

original: yad uktaṃ /
analyzed: yat uktam
translated: It is said:

original: yad api tad ānanda karmāyatyāṃ punarbhavāya saṃvartate idam atra bhavasya /
analyzed: yat api tat ānanda karma āyatyām punarbhavāya saṃvartate idam atra bhavasya
translated: And whatever that is, Ānanda, karma that leads to rebirth in the future, that is existence here.

original: iyaṃ bhavaprajñaptir yatrāyatyāṃ punarbhavābhinirvartakaṃ karma bhava uktaṃ bhagavatā /🔽katamā bhavaprajñaptir yatropapattyāṃgikāḥ DhskD
analyzed: iyam bhava prajñaptiḥ yatra āyatyām punarbhava abhinirvartakam karma bhavaḥ uktam bhagavatā  katamā bhava prajñaptiḥ yatra upapatti āṃgikāḥ
translated: This is the designation of existence where the karma that brings about rebirth in the future is said to be existence by the Blessed One.

original: paṃca skandhā bhava uktā bhagavatā /
analyzed: paṃca skandhāḥ bhavaḥ uktāḥ bhagavatā
translated: What is the designation of existence where the five aggregates with the members of rebirth are said to be existence by the Blessed One?

original: yad uktaṃ /
analyzed: yat uktam
translated: It is said:🔽And whatever that is, Ānanda, karma that leads to rebirth in the future, that is existence here.

original: vijñānaṃ phalgunāhāraṃ yāvad evāyatyāṃ punarbhavābhinirvartaye prādurbhāvāya /
analyzed: vijñānam phalguna āhāram yāvat eva āyatyām punarbhava abhinirvartaye prādurbhāvāya
translated: Consciousness is the nourishment for the weak, just for the manifestation of rebirth in the future.

original: iyaṃ bhavaprajñaptir yatropapattyāṃgikāḥ paṃca skandhā bhava uktaṃ bhagavatā /
analyzed: iyam bhava prajñaptiḥ yatra upapatti āṃgikāḥ paṃca skandhāḥ bhavaḥ uktam bhagavatā
translated: This is the designation of becoming, where the five aggregates with the factors of rebirth are said to be becoming by the Blessed One.

original: api DhskD khalv evam uktaṃ bhagavatā nidānaparyāye vyākaraṇe āyuṣmaty ānande /
analyzed: api dhskd khalu evam uktam bhagavatā nidāna paryāye vyākaraṇe āyuṣmati ānande
translated: Moreover, this was said by the Blessed One in the Nidana-parivarta in the Vyakarana of the Venerable Ananda:

original: asti pratyayam ānanda bhavo /
analyzed: asti pratyayam ānanda
translated: Ananda, there is a condition for becoming.

original: vistareṇa yāvat /
analyzed: vistareṇa yāvat
translated: In detail, up to:

original: sarvaśo vā punar ānanda upādāne asati api nu bhavaḥ prajñāyeta /
analyzed: sarvaśas vā punar ānanda upādāne asati api nu bhavaḥ prajñāyeta
translated: Ananda, if there were no grasping at all, in every way, would becoming be discerned?

original: no bhadanta /🔽tasmāt tarhy ānanda etan nidānaṃ DhskD
analyzed: no bhadanta  tasmāt tarhi ānandaḥ etat nidānam
translated: No, Venerable One.

original: caiṣa hetur eṣa samudaya eṣa pratyayo bhavasya yad utopādānaṃ /
analyzed: ca eṣa hetuḥ eṣa samudayaḥ eṣa pratyayaḥ bhavasya yat uta upādānam
translated: Therefore, Ananda, this is the source, the cause, the origin, the condition for becoming, namely, grasping.

original: upādānapratyayam ānanda bhava /
analyzed: upādāna pratyayam ānanda bhava
translated: Ananda, becoming has grasping as its condition.

original: iti yad uktam idaṃ me tat pratyuktaṃ //
analyzed: iti yat uktam idam me tat pratyuktam
translated: This is the answer to that.

original: bhavapratyayā jātiḥ
analyzed: bhava pratyayā jātiḥ
translated: Birth has becoming as its condition.

original: bhavapratyayā jātiḥ katamā /
analyzed: bhava pratyayā jātiḥ katamā
translated: What is birth that has becoming as its condition?

original: āha /
analyzed: āha
translated: He says:

original: yathā khalv ihaikatyo rāgaparyavasthito DhskD
analyzed: yathā khalu iha ekatyaḥ rāga paryavasthitaḥ
translated: For example, here someone, being possessed by passion,

original: dveṣaparyavasthito mohaparyavasthitaḥ kāyena duścaritaṃ carati vācā manasā duścaritaṃ carati /
analyzed: dveṣa paryavasthitaḥ moha paryavasthitaḥ kāyena duścaritam carati vācā manasā duścaritam carati
translated: Being obsessed with hatred, being obsessed with delusion, one engages in misconduct with the body, speech, and mind.

original: ye te akuśalā kāyasaṃskārā vāksaṃskārā manaḥsaṃskārā ayam ucyate akuśalaḥ karmabhavaḥ /
analyzed: ye te kāya saṃskārāḥ vāc saṃskārāḥ manaḥ saṃskārāḥ ayam ucyate akuśalaḥ karma bhavaḥ
translated: Those unwholesome bodily volitions, verbal volitions, and mental volitions are called unwholesome becoming.

original: yad api taddhetu DhskD
analyzed: yat api tad hetu
translated: And that which is its cause,

original: tatpratyayaṃ kāyasya bhedān narakeṣūpapadyate /
analyzed: tad pratyayam kāyasya bhedāt narakeṣu upapadyate
translated: due to the dissolution of the body, one is reborn in the hells.

original: tatra yā jātiḥ saṃjātir avakrāntir abhinirvṛttiḥ prādurbhāvaḥ skandhapratilābho dhātupratilābha āyatanapratilābho jīvitendriyasya prādurbhāva 🔽itīyaṃ jātir DhskD
analyzed: tatra yā jātiḥ saṃjātiḥ avakrāntiḥ abhinirvṛttiḥ prādurbhāvaḥ skandha pratilābhaḥ dhātu pratilābhaḥ āyatana pratilābhaḥ jīvita indriyasya prādurbhāva  iti iyam jātiḥ
translated: There, birth, rebirth, descent, manifestation, appearance, acquisition of the aggregates, acquisition of the elements, acquisition of the sense bases, the arising of the life faculty,🔽this is called birth.

original: imaṃ bhavaṃ pratītya tad ucyate bhavapratyayā jātir /
analyzed: imam bhavam pratītya tat ucyate bhava pratyayā jātiḥ
translated: This is dependent on this becoming, therefore it is said that birth has becoming as its condition.

original: iti yathā narakeṣv evaṃ tiryakpreteṣu /
analyzed: iti yathā narakeṣu evam tiryak preteṣu
translated: Just as in the hells, so also in the animal realm and the ghost realm.

original: yathā khalv ihaikatyo manuṣyasukhakānām avekṣāvān bhavati pratibaddhacittaḥ /
analyzed: yathā khalu iha ekatyaḥ manuṣya sukhakānām avekṣāvān bhavati pratibaddha cittaḥ
translated: Just as here someone is attentive to the happiness of humans, his mind is attached.

original: tasyaivaṃ bhavaty /
analyzed: tasya evam bhavati
translated: He thinks like this:

original: aho batāhaṃ manuṣyasubhagānāṃ DhskD 🔽sabhāgatāyām upapadyeyam iti /
analyzed: aho bata aham manuṣya subhagānām dhskd 🔽sabhā gatāyām upapadyeyam iti
translated: Oh, may I be reborn in the same state as the fortunate humans.

original: sa tatprārthayamānas taddhetos tatsaṃvartanīyaṃ kāyena sucaritaṃ carati vācā manasā sucaritaṃ carati /
analyzed: sa tat prārthayamānaḥ tad hetoḥ tat saṃvartanīyam kāyena su caritam carati vācā manasā su caritam carati
translated: Desiring that, for that reason, he practices good conduct with the body, good conduct with speech and mind, that leads to that.

original: ye te kuśalāḥ kāyasaṃskārā vāksaṃskārā manaḥsaṃskārā DhskD
analyzed: ye te kuśalāḥ kāya saṃskārāḥ vāc saṃskārāḥ manaḥ saṃskārāḥ
translated: Those wholesome bodily volitions, verbal volitions, and mental volitions,

original: ayam ucyate kuśalaḥ karmabhavaḥ /
analyzed: ayam ucyate kuśalaḥ karma bhavaḥ
translated: this is called wholesome becoming.

original: yad api taddhetu tatpratyayaṃ kāyasya bhedān manuṣyasubhagānāṃ sabhāgatāyām upapadyate /
analyzed: yat api tad hetu tad pratyayam kāyasya bhedāt manuṣya subhagānām sabhā gatāyām upapadyate
translated: And by that cause and condition, after the dissolution of the body, he is reborn in the same class as the fortunate humans.

original: tatra yā jātiḥ saṃjātir vistareṇa tad ucyate bhavapratyayā jāti /
analyzed: tatra yā jātiḥ saṃjātiḥ vistareṇa tat ucyate bhava pratyayā
translated: There, birth, rebirth, in detail, that is called birth with becoming as condition.

original: yathā manuṣyasubhagānāṃ DhskD
analyzed: yathā manuṣya subhagānām dhskd
translated: Just as for the fortunate humans,

original: evaṃ cāturmahārājikānāṃ trayastriṃśānāṃ yāmānāṃ tuṣitānāṃ nirmāṇaratīnāṃ paranirmitavaśavartināṃ /🔽yathā khalv ihaikatyo brahmakāyikānāṃ devānām avekṣāvān bhavati pratibaddhacittaḥ tasyaivaṃ bhavaty DhskD /
analyzed: evam cāturmahārājikānām trayastriṃśānām yāmānām tuṣitānām nirmāṇaratīnām paranirmitavaśavartinām  yathā khalu iha ekatyaḥ brahmakāyikānām devānām avekṣāvān bhavati pratibaddha cittaḥ tasya evam bhavati
translated: so for the Caturmaharajakas, the Trayastrimsas, the Yamas, the Tusitas, the Nirmāṇaratis, and the Paranirmitavaśavartins.

original: aho batāhaṃ brahmakāyikānāṃ devānāṃ sabhāgatāyām upapadyeyam iti /
analyzed: aho bata aham brahmakāyikānām devānām sabhā gatāyām upapadyeyam iti
translated: Just as here someone is intent on the Brahmakāyika gods, his mind is attached, he thinks thus: 'Oh, may I be reborn in the same class as the Brahmakāyika gods.'

original: sa tatprārthayamānas taddhetos tatsaṃvartanīyaṃ viviktaṃ kāmair viviktaṃ pāpakair akuśalair dharmaiḥ savitarkaṃ savicāraṃ vivekajaṃ DhskD
analyzed: sa tat prārthayamānaḥ tad hetoḥ tat saṃvartanīyam viviktam kāmaiḥ viviktam pāpakaiḥ akuśalaiḥ dharmaiḥ sa vitarkam sa vicāram viveka jam dhskd
translated: Desiring that, for the sake of that, he cultivates that which leads to it, the first absorption, which is secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unwholesome states, and consists of reasoning and investigation, born of seclusion,

original: prītisukhaṃ prathamaṃ dhyānam upasaṃpadya viharati /
analyzed: prīti sukham prathamam dhyānam upasaṃpadya viharati
translated: Desiring that, for that purpose, he attains and dwells in the first meditation, which is accompanied by reasoning and investigation, born of detachment, and filled with joy and happiness, by turning away from sensual pleasures and by turning away from evil and unwholesome dharmas.

original: tathā samāpannasya yaḥ kāyasaṃvaro vāksaṃvara ājīvapariśuddhir ayam ucyate kuśalaḥ karmabhavaḥ /
analyzed: tathā samāpannasya yaḥ kāya saṃvaraḥ vāc saṃvaraḥ ājīva pariśuddhiḥ ayam ucyate kuśalaḥ karma bhavaḥ
translated: The restraint of body, speech, and livelihood of one who has attained such a state is called wholesome becoming.

original: yad api taddhetu tatpratyayaṃ kāyasya bhedād DhskD
analyzed: yat api tad hetu tad pratyayam kāyasya bhedāt
translated: And that which, on account of that cause and those conditions, after the dissolution of the body,

original: brahmakāyikānāṃ devānāṃ sabhāgatāyām upapadyate /
analyzed: brahmakāyikānām devānām sabhā gatāyām upapadyate
translated: is reborn in the company of the Brahmakāyika gods.

original: tatra jātiḥ saṃjātir vistareṇa yāvad /
analyzed: tatra jātiḥ saṃjātiḥ vistareṇa yāvat
translated: There, birth, rebirth, and so on in detail, up to

original: iyaṃ jātir imaṃ bhavaṃ pratītya tad ucyate bhavapratyayā jātir iti /
analyzed: iyam jātiḥ imam bhavam pratītya tat ucyate bhava pratyayā jātiḥ iti
translated: this birth, is called birth with that becoming as its condition.

original: yathā brahmakāyikānāṃ evaṃ brahmapurohitānāṃ mahābrahmaṇāṃ /
analyzed: yathā brahmakāyikānām evam brahmapurohitānām mahābrahmaṇām
translated: Just as with the Brahmakāyika gods, so also with the Brahmapurohita and Mahābrahmā gods.

original: DhskD yathā khalv ihaikatyaḥ parīttābhānāṃ devānām avekṣāvān bhavati pratibaddhacittaḥ /
analyzed: yathā khalu iha ekatyaḥ parītta ābhānām devānām avekṣāvān bhavati pratibaddha cittaḥ
translated: Just as here someone is intent on the Parīttābha gods, his mind is attached to them.

original: tasyaivaṃ bhavaty /
analyzed: tasya evam bhavati
translated: He thinks like this:🔽Oh, may I, with the breakup of the body, after death, be reborn in the company of the Parīttābha gods!

original: aho batāhaṃ parīttābhānāṃ devānāṃ sabhāgatāyām upapadyeyam iti /
analyzed: aho bata aham parīttābhānām devānām sabhā gatāyām upapadyeyam iti
translated: He thinks, Oh, may I be reborn in the company of the gods of Limited Radiance!

original: sa tatprārthayamāno vitarkavicārāṇāṃ vyupaśamād DhskD
analyzed: sa tat prārthayamānaḥ vitarka vicārāṇām vyupaśamāt
translated: Desiring that, through the subsiding of initial and sustained thought,

original: adhyātmasaṃprasādāc cetasa ekotībhāvād avitarkam avicāraṃ samādhijaṃ prītisukhaṃ dvitīyaṃ dhyānam upasaṃpadya viharati /
analyzed: adhyātma saṃprasādāt cetasaḥ ekotībhāvāt a vitarkam a vicāram samādhi jam prīti sukham dvitīyam dhyānam upasaṃpadya viharati
translated: through the mind being internally serene, unified, and concentrated, he attains and dwells in the second dhyāna, which is without initial or sustained thought, and is born of concentration, filled with the joy and pleasure born of concentration.

original: tathā samāpannasya yaḥ kāyasaṃvaro vāksaṃvara ājīvapariśuddhiḥ ayam ucyate DhskD
analyzed: tathā samāpannasya yaḥ kāya saṃvaraḥ vāc saṃvaraḥ ājīva pariśuddhiḥ ayam ucyate dhskd
translated: The restraint of body, speech, and livelihood, and the purification of livelihood for one who has attained this,

original: kuśalaḥ karmabhavaḥ /
analyzed: kuśalaḥ karma bhavaḥ
translated: this is called the wholesome becoming.

original: yad api taddhetu tatpratyayaṃ kāyasya bhedāt parīttābhanāṃ devānāṃ sabhāgatāyām upapadyate /
analyzed: yat api tad hetu tad pratyayam kāyasya bhedāt parītta ābhanām devānām sabhā gatāyām upapadyate
translated: And by that cause and condition, at the dissolution of the body, he is reborn in the company of the gods of Limited Radiance.

original: tatra yā jātiḥ saṃjātir vistareṇa jīvitendriyasya prādurbhāvaḥ /
analyzed: tatra yā jātiḥ saṃjātiḥ vistareṇa jīvita indriyasya prādurbhāvaḥ
translated: There, birth, rebirth, in detail, the appearance of the life faculty,

original: itīyaṃ jātir imaṃ bhavam DhskD
analyzed: iti iyam jātiḥ imam bhavam
translated: this birth depends on this becoming,

original: pratītya tad ucyate bhavapratyayā jātiḥ /
analyzed: pratītya tat ucyate bhava pratyayā jātiḥ
translated: therefore it is said that birth has becoming as its condition.

analyzed: yathā parītta ābhānām evam apramāṇa ābhānām ābhāsvarāṇām
translated: As with the gods of Limited Radiance, so with the gods of Immeasurable Radiance and the Radiant Gods.

original: tasyaivaṃ bhavaty /🔽aho batāhaṃ DhskD
analyzed: tasya evam bhavati  aho bata aham dhskd
translated: He thinks like this:

analyzed: parītta śubhānām devānām sabhā gatāyām upapadyeyam  sa tat prārthayamānaḥ tad hetoḥ tat saṃvartanīyam prīteḥ virāgāt upekṣakaḥ viharati
translated: Oh, may I be reborn in the company of the gods of Limited Virtue.

original: smṛtaḥ saṃprajānan sukhaṃ ca kāyena pratisaṃvedayate /
analyzed: smṛtaḥ saṃprajānan sukham ca kāyena pratisaṃvedayate
translated: Desiring that, for that reason, for that purpose, through the fading away of joy, he dwells in equanimity, mindful, clearly knowing, experiencing pleasure with the body.

original: yat DhskD tad āryā ācakṣate upekṣakaḥ smṛtimāṃ sukhavihārīti tṛtīyaṃ dhyānam upasaṃpadya viharati /
analyzed: yat dhskd tat āryāḥ ācakṣate upekṣakaḥ smṛtimām sukha vihārī iti tṛtīyam dhyānam upasaṃpadya viharati
translated: The noble ones describe this as: He dwells in equanimity, mindful, experiencing pleasure. He dwells having attained the third absorption.

original: tathā samāpannasya yaḥ kāyasaṃvaro vāksaṃvaraḥ ājīvapariśuddhir ayam ucyate kuśalaḥ karmabhavaḥ /
analyzed: tathā samāpannasya yaḥ kāya saṃvaraḥ vāc saṃvaraḥ ājīva pariśuddhiḥ ayam ucyate kuśalaḥ karma bhavaḥ
translated: The restraint of body, speech, and livelihood of one who has attained such a state is called wholesome becoming.

original: DhskD yad api taddhetu tatpratyayaṃ kāyasya bhedāt parīttaśubhānāṃ devānāṃ sabhāgatāyām upapadyate /
analyzed: yat api tad hetu tad pratyayam kāyasya bhedāt parītta śubhānām devānām sabhā gatāyām upapadyate
translated: And the rebirth in the company of the gods of Limited Virtue through the breaking up of the body, due to that cause and condition,

original: tatra yā jātiḥ saṃjātir vistareṇa /
analyzed: tatra yā jātiḥ saṃjātiḥ vistareṇa
translated: the birth there, the being born, the being produced, the manifestation of the aggregates, the acquisition of the sense spheres, the manifestation of the physical body - this is called birth.

original: iyam ucyate bhavapratyayā jātir iti /
analyzed: iyam ucyate bhava pratyayā jātiḥ iti
translated: This is said to be birth with becoming as its condition.

original: yathā parīttaśubhānām evam DhskD
analyzed: yathā parītta śubhānām evam dhskd
translated: As for the gods of Limited Radiance, so also for the gods of Immeasurable Radiance and the gods of Streaming Radiance.

original: apramāṇaśubhānāṃ śubhakṛtsnānāṃ /
analyzed: apramāṇa śubhānām śubha kṛtsnānām
translated: As for the gods of Limited Radiance, so also for the gods of Immeasurable Radiance and the gods of Streaming Radiance.

original: yathā khalv ihaikatyaḥ anabhrakāṇāṃ devānām avekṣāvān bhavati pratibaddhacittaḥ /
analyzed: yathā khalu iha ekatyaḥ anabhrakāṇām devānām avekṣāvān bhavati pratibaddha cittaḥ
translated: For example, just as someone here is attentive to the gods of the cloudless realm, with a mind attached [to them].

original: tasyaivaṃ bhavaty /
analyzed: tasya evam bhavati
translated: For him it occurs in this way:

original: aho batāham anabhrakāṇāṃ devānāṃ sabhāgatāyām upapadyeyam iti /
analyzed: aho bata aham anabhrakāṇām devānām sabhā gatāyām upapadyeyam iti
translated: Oh, may I be reborn in the company of the gods of the cloudless realm.

original: sa tatprārthayamānas DhskD
analyzed: sa tat prārthayamānaḥ
translated: He, desiring that,

original: taddhetos tatsaṃvartanīyaṃ sukhasya ca prahāṇād duḥkhasya ca prahāṇāt pūrvam eva🔽ca saumanasyadaurmanasyayor astagamād aduḥkhāsukhaṃ upekṣāsmṛtipariśuddhaṃ caturthaṃ
analyzed: tad hetoḥ tat saṃvartanīyam sukhasya ca prahāṇāt duḥkhasya ca prahāṇāt pūrvam eva  ca saumanasya daurmanasyayoḥ asta gamāt aduḥkha asukham upekṣā smṛti pariśuddham caturtham
translated: for that reason, for that cause, having abandoned pleasure, having abandoned pain,

original: dhyānam upasaṃpadya viharati /
analyzed: dhyānam upasaṃpadya viharati
translated: and previously having removed joy and sorrow, dwells having attained the fourth meditation, which is neither painful nor pleasant, and is purified in equanimity and mindfulness.

original: DhskD tathā samāpannasya yaḥ kāyasaṃvaro vāksaṃvara ājīvapariśuddhir ayam ucyate kuśalaḥ karmabhavaḥ /
analyzed: tathā samāpannasya yaḥ kāya saṃvaraḥ vāc saṃvaraḥ ājīva pariśuddhiḥ ayam ucyate kuśalaḥ karma bhavaḥ
translated: As for one who has attained it in that way, the restraint of body, speech, and the purification of livelihood, this is called wholesome action.

original: yad api taddhetu tatpratyayaṃ kāyasya bhedād anabhrakāṇāṃ devānāṃ sabhāgatāyām upapadyate DhskD /
analyzed: yat api tad hetu tad pratyayam kāyasya bhedāt anabhrakāṇām devānām sabhā gatāyām upapadyate
translated: And also, by that cause, by that condition, after the dissolution of the body, he is reborn in the company of the gods of the cloudless realm.

original: tatra yā jātiḥ saṃjātiḥ vistareṇa yāvaj jīvitendriyasya prādurbhāvaḥ /
analyzed: tatra yā jātiḥ saṃjātiḥ vistareṇa yāvat jīvita indriyasya prādurbhāvaḥ
translated: Among them, birth is the appearance of the faculty of life up to the birth, complete birth, of sentient beings.

original: itīyaṃ jātir imaṃ bhavaṃ pratītya tad ucyate bhavapratyayā jātiḥ /
analyzed: iti iyam jātiḥ imam bhavam pratītya tat ucyate bhava pratyayā jātiḥ
translated: Thus, this birth is dependent on this existence. Therefore, it is said that birth has existence as its condition.

original: yathā anabhrakāṇām evaṃ puṇyaprasavānām DhskD
analyzed: yathā anabhrakāṇām evam puṇyaprasavānām
translated: Just as for the Akaniṣṭhas, so also for the Puṇyaprasavas.

original: asaṃjñisatvasaṃgṛhītānāṃ ca bṛhatphalānāṃ /
analyzed: asaṃjñi satva saṃgṛhītānām ca bṛhat phalānām
translated: And for the Bṛhatphalas included in the non-percipient beings.

original: yathā khalv ihaikatyaḥ asaṃjñisatvānāṃ devānām avekṣāvān bhavati pratibaddhacittaḥ /
analyzed: yathā khalu iha ekatyaḥ asaṃjñi satvānām devānām avekṣāvān bhavati pratibaddha cittaḥ
translated: For example, here someone has a desire and an attached mind for the gods in the non-percipient realm.

original: tasyaivaṃ bhavaty /
analyzed: tasya evam bhavati
translated: He thinks like this:
